Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000603
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 24, 2025
License #: CI670290163
Licensee Group Organization: Eagle Village Inc
Licensee Designee: Cathey Prudhomme
Chief Administrator: Cathey Prudhomme
Agency Name: Eagle Village Putnam
Agency Address: 4650 165th Ave
Hersey, MI 49639-8776
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 06/19/2025
Capacity: 10
II. METHODOLOGY

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth had a sexually inappropriate relationship with a staff at the
facility between March 2023 and August 2024.
Investigation Interviews:
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on April 24, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist said she was
informed Youth A had disclosed these allegations to Staff 1
however did not have any further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the Children’s
Assessment Center of South-Central Michigan on May 6,
2025, by a Forensic Interviewer, and I was present via
TEAMS. Youth A said he told Staff 1 about what happened to him
when he was placed at Eagle Village, however, he said he did not
want to discuss it further. Youth A eventually reported that there
was a sexual incident with Staff 3 about a year ago when he was
14, “in mid-summer, maybe July”, by an outdoor pool when she
was a lifeguard. Youth A said no other staff or youth were present
and he and Staff 3 were alone in the pool. Youth A said it only
happened one time and he told one male youth at the facility but
refused to disclose the youth’s name. Youth A refused to disclose
any details and reported he does not want to deal with any of it as
it is in the past and he has other things to focus on. Youth A then
asked if they could end the interview.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 8,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B said he is
placed at Putnam house and has been there for a few years,
noting Youth A was placed there at the same time. Youth B said
youth are allowed to go to the pool two to three times per week in
the summer. Youth B said all the boy houses go on the same days
so there are many youth at the pool at a time. Youth B denied
youth being allowed to go to the pool alone at any time. Youth B
said house staff will go with the youth and the pool has a lifeguard
and “lifeguard helper” at the pool as well. Youth B said the
lifeguard usually sits on the side of the pool or walks around the
pool supervising the youth that are swimming. Youth B said Staff 3
2

was one of the lifeguards, noting she was “cool but strict with the
rules”. Youth B said Youth A would go to the pool and make
inappropriate comments about the female staff in swimming suits.
Youth B said he has no knowledge of Youth A doing anything
inappropriately with any staff. Youth B said he has never seen
Staff 3 with inappropriate boundaries with Youth A or any other
youth. Youth B said if youth tried to joke with Staff 3 about
anything inappropriate, she would stop it immediately and redirect
the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on May 6, 2025, in
collaboration with the MDHSS worker and Law Enforcement.
Staff 1 said she is a former employee of another child caring
institution and was a direct care staff for Youth A. Staff 1 said
Youth A would often boast about his sexual experiences to other
youth in the program. Staff 1 said Youth A was talking in the milieu
area to anyone that would listen and said he had sex with an 18-
year-old lifeguard while placed at Eagle Village. Staff 1 said Youth
A made a comment “I have been with an 18-year-old and can
again”. Staff 1 said she did not ask any additional details and
denied Youth A providing a name or location of the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on May 6, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement.
Staff 2 said she is an employee at another child caring institution
and is a direct care staff for Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A will talk
about his past sexual experiences with other youth. Staff 2 said
she has never heard him talking about a sexual experience with a
staff or anyone over the age of 18. Staff 2 said Youth A has talked
about being placed at Eagle Village but never disclosed any
concerns about the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 8,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 3 said she was a former Camp Leader and
then direct care staff at Eagle Village starting summer of 2023
until spring of 2024. Staff 3 said she was a lifeguard in the
summer of 2023 and then transitioned over to a direct care staff
once the pool closed, sometime around the end of August 2023.
Staff 3 said she was a direct care staff at Ashmun house however
worked shifts in all of the houses including Putnam house. Staff 3
said when she was a lifeguard, she would have shifts with the
camp youth as well as the residential youth. Staff 3 said all of the
boy houses would come to the pool at the same time so there
were typically 12-15 youth at a time with 3-5 direct care staff. Staff
3 said she was never counted in ratio with the youth while
3

lifeguarding. Staff 3 said she and another lifeguard would be at the
pool with the youth and staff. Staff 3 said she would sit on the
edge of the pool or walk around the pool and continuously watch
the youth to ensure safety. Staff 3 said she was never at the pool
with one youth, noting there always needed to be direct care staff
with any residential youth and a second camp staff as a lifeguard.
Staff 3 said she never saw anytime when a single youth was
allowed at the pool. Staff 3 said she remembered Youth A when
she was lifeguarding as he would come with the other youth to the
pool to swim and then when she became a direct care staff she
learned his name and got to know him a little bit due to working at
Putnam house at times. Staff 3 said she does not recall any times
when Youth A was inappropriate at the pool or when she worked
with him. Staff 3 denied him ever talking sexually towards her,
writing her notes, or having any sexual encounters with him. Staff
3 said Youth A was disrespectful towards her and would curse at
her and threaten to AWOL but never any boundary issues. Staff 3
denied any sexual touching, or inappropriate contact with Youth A
or any other youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
8, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Supervisor said she is the Director of Residential
services however she also supervised Staff 3 for about six
months. Supervisor said Staff 3 was assigned to Ashmun house
as a direct care worker. Supervisor said Staff 3 was out for injuries
a few times during her employment however worked well with the
youth and was a great staff. Supervisor said she never had to
discipline Staff 3 when she supervised her. Supervisor said Staff 3
was a lifeguard through the camp program and is not aware of a
time that she would have acted as a lifeguard while a direct care
staff as lifeguards do not count in ratio and as a direct care staff,
Staff 3 would have been required to be in ratio with the youth at
the pool. Supervisor said Staff 3 was not assigned to work in
Putnam nor did she pick up shifts in any other house, noting she
would have been aware as she was Staff 3’s direct supervisor.
Supervisor said there was no reason Staff 3 would have had any
contact with Youth A unless she responded to an incident
somewhere else on campus. Supervisor said she has no
knowledge of Staff 3 being inappropriate with any youth.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed all onboarding training between May
31, 2023, and June 9, 2023. Staff 3 completed lifeguard
training on June 16, 2023. Staff 3 was a Staff Cabin Leader
4

from May 30, 2023 until August 28, 2023, and a Direct Care
Staff from August 29, 2023 until July 26, 2024. Staff 3’s last
shift as a direct care worker was April 11, 2024, due to an
injury. Staff 3 never came back to work and her termination
date was July 26, 2024, due to moving.
The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, there is no evidence that Staff 3 was sexually
inappropriate with Youth A. Youth A was 14 years old during the
summer of 2024 at which time Staff 3 did not work due to her
injury.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
_____________________________________June 9, 2025_
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
